summary: This is an email from an Assistant U.S. Attorney to Alex Acosta regarding the unsealing of a reply brief by attorney Tein in the Epstein civil litigation. The email notes that Tein's brief quotes extensively from and criticizes the deferred-prosecution agreement in the Epstein case, and mentions that the sender has not yet heard back from defense attorney Roy Black regarding an agreement filed in state court.

persons.name: Alex Acosta
persons.context: Recipient of the email discussing the Epstein civil litigation and the deferred-prosecution agreement.

persons.name: Tein
persons.context: Filed a reply brief in the Epstein civil litigation that quotes from and criticizes the deferred-prosecution agreement as 'highly unusual and unprecedented'.

persons.name: Roy Black
persons.context: Defense attorney who filed an agreement with the state court; the email sender notes not having heard back from him.

connections.description: Tein is criticizing the deferred-prosecution agreement likely overseen by Acosta's office in his reply brief.
Both are attorneys involved in legal proceedings related to the Epstein case, with Tein filing a brief and Black filing an agreement in state court.

events.title: Tein's Reply Brief Unsealed
events.description: The clerk's office unsealed attorney Tein's reply brief in the Epstein civil litigation, which quotes extensively from and criticizes the deferred-prosecution agreement.

locations: 500 S. Australian Ave, West Palm Beach, FL 33401
keyFacts: Attorney Tein's reply brief in the Epstein civil litigation was unsealed, and it quotes extensively from the deferred-prosecution agreement.
Tein describes the deferred-prosecution agreement as 'a highly unusual and unprecedented' agreement.
The agreement itself was not filed with the court, but Tein's brief references it.
The email indicates ongoing communication issues regarding an agreement filed by defense attorney Roy Black in state court.
